column4: i have a question. i have a pc that only has a dialup modem on it that i'm trying to get to work. if i need say linux-headers i know if i had a connection i could do apt-get install linux-headers or whatever. how can i save this information to a file (tar) so i can transfer it to another computer (the one that is not working with internet) ?
look at apt-zip
you're using synaptic, right?
it looks like, from the error, that you've added a new repository
and haven't apt-get update , so it's saying it should have that file (from the repository) but it doesn't
that's where I would look
np
you gotta chance to post your sources.list yet?
just repeat the deb line and head it with deb-src
this is working thanks question though you happen to know where i can find the libmp3lame source or whatever?
compile, right?
did you notice I have no sources in my sources.list (pun intended)
but with those repositories, do an apt-cache search lame | grep lame
no offence, but there are two things I never do: networking and compiling, because nearly everyone knows more than i do ;)
normally /boot is on the / partition in ubuntu.
you wouldn't mount /boot, you'd mount /
then boot is at /boot on your mounted partition
if that's the partition that has /
well, I'd use sudo fdisk -l, and try mounting partitions until I found the right one
are you running a livecd?
which wiki?
that page makes it harder than it is :)
ok, where are you mounting your hda2?
